Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Ultrasound-Guided Percutaneous Cryoneurolysis for Traumatic Rib Fractures

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised controlled trial included adults with one to six rib fractures

Participants.evidence: included adults with one to six rib fractures. Conducted at the University of California-San Diego

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either active cryoneurolysis with a sham peripheral nerve block or sham cryoneurolysis with an active peripheral nerve block

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the effectiveness of ultrasound-guided percutaneous cryoneurolysis in enhancing analgesia and inspiratory volume

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the maximum inspired volume measured with an incentive spirometer the day after the procedure

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was stratified by laterality using sealed envelopes

Number_Randomised.evidence: From April 2020 to August 2023, 20 participants were randomised: 11 to the cryoneurolysis group and 9 to the peripheral nerve block group

Number_Analysed.evidence: 11 to the cryoneurolysis group and 9 to the peripheral nerve block group

Result_Outcome.evidence: The adjusted mean difference in maximum inspired volume was 793 ml greater in the cryoneurolysis group (95% CI, 273 to 1,312 ml; p = 0.005)

Harms.evidence: One participant in the cryoneurolysis group developed pneumonia, which was successfully treated with antibiotics

Funding.evidence: The trial was funded by Epimed International, which also provided the cryoneurolysis devices
